intro: Haselhoffia leucophthalma, commonly known as the white-flowered haselhoffia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are typically long and pinnately arranged. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
